author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after a Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) bus driver attempted self-immolation in front of Chathirakudi police station, alleging that a police team tried to misbehave with his wife, the district police have registered First Information Report (FIR) against an Inspector and three other police personnel.

S. Gopal (37), the victim, who is undergoing treatment at the Government Hospital here with 60 per cent burns, said that he was upset over the police team, led by Raja, Inspector of Police, attached to the Chathirakudi police station, tried to implicate him in an assault case and tried to misbehave with his wife when they visited his house on Tuesday morning in search of him.

Acting on a complaint lodged by S. Jayaraj (51), brother of the victim, the police booked the Inspector of Police and three other policemen, Rajiv Gandhi, Satheesh, Krishnavelu and one Rajesh Kanna under Section 354 IPC (assaulting or using criminal force on a woman with an intention to outrage her modesty).

They were also booked under Sections 448 (house trespass), 294 (b) (uttering obscene words), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt) read with 309 (attempt to commit suicide) of IPC, police said.

Superintendent of Police N. Manivannan has appointed Deputy Superintendent of Police Ponnarasu as the investigating officer in the case.
title: FIR filed against four policemen in Ramanathapuram district
